com.vector.cfg.automation.scripting.base.paths

Interface IAutomationPathsApi


  • @PublishedApi(value=ADDITIONS_ALLOWED)
 @PublishedApiDomain(value=AUTOMATION_IF)
public interface IAutomationPathsApi
    Script tasks could resolve relative and absolute file system paths with the IAutomationPathsApi.

    As entry point call paths in a code{ } block (see IScriptExecutionContext.getPaths()).

    There are multiple ways to resolve relative paths:
    • by Script folder
    • by Temp folder
    • by SIP folder
    • by Project folder
    • by any parent folder
    The IAutomationPathsApi will also resolve any other Vector provided path variable like $(EcucFile). The call would be paths.ecucFile, add the variable to resolve as a Groovy property. Short list of available variables (not complete, please see DaVinci Configurator help for more details):
    • EcucFile
    • OutputFolder
    • SystemFolder
    • AutosarFolder
    • more ...

    (c) Copyright Vctr Informatik GmbH. All Rights Reserved.

      • getDpaProjectFolder

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getDpaProjectFolder()
        Return the project folder of the current active project.
        Returns:
        the dpa project folder
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException -
        • if there is not active project available

      • getScriptFolder

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getScriptFolder()
        Return the folder where the currently executed IScript is located.

      • getSipRootFolder

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getSipRootFolder()
        Return the SIP root folder. If multiple SIP folders exist the primary folder is returned.
        Returns:
        the sip root folder

      • getTempFolder

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path getTempFolder()
        Returns a temporary created file system folder for this running IScriptTask.

        The Path is absolute and the folder exists.

        The folder is created at the first invocation, and will return the same folder for subsequent calls. For a new execution a new folder is returned.

        Returns:
        the script temp folder

      • resolvePath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolvePath(java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path and preserves the relative path.

        Path Resolution

        The resolvePath(Object) method resolves the Object to a file path. Relative paths are preserved, so relative paths are not converted into absolute paths.

        This method converts the supplied path same as the resolvePath(Path, Object) method. The return type is java.nio.file.Path. But it does NOT convert relative paths into absolute.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance

      • resolvePath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolvePath(java.nio.file.Path parentPath,
                                                 java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path relative to the passed parentPath directory.

        Path Resolution by Parent Folder

        The resolvePath(Path parent, Object path) method resolves a file path relative to supplied parent folder.

        This method converts the supplied path based on its type:

        • A CharSequence, including String or GString. Interpreted relative to the parent directory. A string that starts with file: is treated as a file URL.
        • A File: If the file is an absolute file, it is returned as is. Otherwise, the file's path is interpreted relative to the parent directory.
        • A Path: If the path is an absolute path, it is returned as is. Otherwise, the path is interpreted relative to the parent directory.
        • A URI or URL: The URL's path is interpreted as the file path. Currently, only file: URLs are supported.
        • A IHasURI: The returned URI is interpreted as defined above.
        • A Closure: The closure's return value is resolved recursively.
        • A Callable: The callable's return value is resolved recursively.
        • A Supplier: The supplier's return value is resolved recursively.
        • A Provider: The provider's return value is resolved recursively.

        The return type is java.nio.file.Path.

        Parameters:
        parentPath - the parent path to use for relative paths
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance

      • resolveProjectPath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolveProjectPath(java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path relative to the project directory (see getDpaProjectFolder()) of the current active project.

        Project Folder Path Resolution

        The resolveProjectPath(Object) method resolves a file path relative to the project directory (see getDpaProjectFolder()) of the current active project.

        This method converts the supplied path same as the resolvePath(Path, Object) method. The return type is java.nio.file.Path.

        There must be an active project to use this method.

        Parameters:
        parentPath - the parent path to use for relative paths
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance

      • resolveScriptPath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolveScriptPath(java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path relative to the script directory of the executed IScript (see #getScript()).

        Script Folder Path Resolution

        The resolveScriptPath(Object) method resolves a file path relative to the script directory of the executed IScript.

        This method converts the supplied path same as the resolvePath(Path, Object) method. The return type is java.nio.file.Path.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance

      • resolveSipPath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolveSipPath(java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path relative to the SIP directory (see getSipRootFolder()).

        Sip Folder Path Resolution

        The resolveSipPath(Object) method resolves a file path relative to the SIP directory (see getSipRootFolder()).

        This method converts the supplied path same as the resolvePath(Path, Object) method. The return type is java.nio.file.Path.

        Parameters:
        parentPath - the parent path to use for relative paths
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance

      • resolveTempPath

        @PublishedMethod
java.nio.file.Path resolveTempPath(java.lang.Object path)
        Resolves a file path relative to the script temp directory of the executed IScript (see #getScript()).

        Temp Folder Path Resolution

        The resolveTempPath(Object) method resolves a file path relative to the script temp directory of the executed IScript. A new temporary folder is created for each IScriptTask execution.

        This method converts the supplied path same as the resolvePath(Path, Object) method. The return type is java.nio.file.Path.

        Parameters:
        path - the path to resolve as Path
        Returns:
        the Path instance
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the path could not be converted to a Path instance
